title: Building Brain Tumor Segmentation Networks with User-Assisted Filter Estimation and Selection
abstract: arXiv:2403.12748v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Brain tumor image segmentation is a challenging research topic in which deep-learning models have presented the best results. However, the traditional way of training those models from many pre-annotated images leaves several unanswered questions. Hence methodologies, such as Feature Learning from Image Markers (FLIM), have involved an expert in the learning loop to reduce human effort in data annotation and build models sufficiently deep for a given problem. FLIM has been successfully used to create encoders, estimating the filters of all convolutional layers from patches centered at marker voxels. In this work, we present Multi-Step (MS) FLIM - a user-assisted approach to estimating and selecting the most relevant filters from multiple FLIM executions. tldr: 使用多步骤FLIM方法，只在第一个卷积层中使用用户辅助的方式来估计和选择最相关的滤波器，实现了脑肿瘤分割网络的改进。
en_tdlr: Improved brain tumor segmentation networks by utilizing Multi-Step FLIM with user-assisted filter estimation and selection in the first convolutional layer.
